verses.verse: But after <S%H4480><s%> a while, <S%H3117><s%> in the time <S%H3117><s%> of wheat <S%H2406><s%> harvest, <S%H7105><s%> it came <S%H1961><s%> about that Samson <S%H8123><s%> visited <S%H6485><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> with a young <S%H1423><s%> goat, <S%H5795><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "I will go <S%H935><s%> in to my wife <S%H802><s%> in [her] room. <S%H2315><s%>" But her father did not let <S%H1><s%> him enter. <S%H5414><s%>

And her father said, <S%H1><s%> "I really <S%H559><s%> thought <S%H559><s%> that you hated <S%H559><s%> her intensely; <S%H8130><s%> so I gave <S%H8130><s%> her to your companion. <S%H5414><s%> Is not her younger <S%H4828><s%> sister <S%H6996><s%> more <S%H269><s%> <S%H4480><s%> beautiful <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H2896><s%> she? Please <S%H4480><s%> let her be yours instead. <S%H4994><s%>"

Samson <S%H8123><s%> then said <S%H559><s%> to them, "This <S%H6471><s%> time <S%H6471><s%> I shall be blameless <S%H5352><s%> in regard <S%H4480><s%> to the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> I do <S%H6213><s%> them harm. <S%H9567><s%>"

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> and caught <S%H3920><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> foxes, <S%H7776><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> torches, <S%H3940><s%> and turned <S%H6437><s%> [the foxes] tail <S%H2180><s%> to tail, <S%H2180><s%> and put <S%H7760><s%> one <S%H259><s%> torch <S%H3940><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> between <S%H996><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> tails. <S%H2180><s%>

When he had set <S%H1197><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> to the torches, <S%H3940><s%> he released <S%H7971><s%> the foxes into the standing <S%H7054><s%> grain <S%H7054><s%> of the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> thus burning <S%H1197><s%> up both <S%H4480><s%> the shocks <S%H1430><s%> and the standing <S%H7054><s%> grain, <S%H7054><s%> along <S%H5704><s%> with the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> [and] groves. <S%H2132><s%>

Then the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Who <S%H4310><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H2088><s%>?" And they said, <S%H559><s%> "Samson, <S%H8123><s%> the son-in-law of the Timnite, <S%H8554><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> he took <S%H3947><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> her to his companion. <S%H4828><s%>" So the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> came <S%H5927><s%> up and burned <S%H8313><s%> her and her father with fire. <S%H1><s%>

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, "Since <S%H518><s%> you act <S%H6213><s%> like this, <S%H2088><s%> I will surely <S%H3588><s%> <S%H518><s%> take <S%H5358><s%> revenge <S%H5358><s%> on you, but after <S%H310><s%> that I will quit. <S%H2308><s%>"

And he struck <S%H5221><s%> them ruthlessly <S%H7785><s%> <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3409><s%> with a great <S%H1419><s%> slaughter; <S%H4347><s%> and he went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> and lived <S%H3427><s%> in the cleft <S%H5585><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> of Etam. <S%H5862><s%>
Then the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> went <S%H5927><s%> up and camped <S%H2583><s%> in Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and spread <S%H6566><s%> out in Lehi. <S%H3896><s%>

And the men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Why <S%H4100><s%> have you come <S%H5927><s%> up against <S%H5921><s%> us?" And they said, <S%H559><s%> "We have come <S%H5927><s%> up to bind <S%H631><s%> Samson <S%H8123><s%> in order to do <S%H6213><s%> to him as he did <S%H6213><s%> to us."

Then 3000 men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the cleft <S%H5585><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> of Etam <S%H5862><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to Samson, <S%H8123><s%> "Do you not know <S%H3045><s%> that the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> are rulers <S%H4910><s%> over us? What <S%H4100><s%> then is this <S%H2088><s%> that you have done <S%H6213><s%> to us?" And he said <S%H559><s%> to them, "As they did <S%H6213><s%> to me, so <S%H3651><s%> I have done <S%H6213><s%> to them."

And they said <S%H559><s%> to him, "We have come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to bind <S%H631><s%> you so that we may give <S%H5414><s%> you into the hands <S%H3027><s%> of the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>" And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, "Swear <S%H7650><s%> to me that you will not kill <S%H6293><s%> me."

So they said <S%H559><s%> to him, "No, <S%H3808><s%> but we will bind <S%H631><s%> you fast <S%H631><s%> and give <S%H5414><s%> you into their hands; <S%H3027><s%> yet surely <S%H4191><s%> we will not kill <S%H4191><s%> you." Then they bound <S%H631><s%> him with two <S%H8147><s%> new <S%H2319><s%> ropes <S%H5688><s%> and brought <S%H5927><s%> him up from the rock. <S%H5553><s%>

When he came <S%H935><s%> to Lehi, <S%H3896><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> shouted <S%H7321><s%> as they met <S%H7122><s%> him. And the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H9484><s%> upon him mightily <S%H9484><s%> so that the ropes <S%H5688><s%> that were on his arms <S%H2220><s%> were as flax <S%H6593><s%> that is burned <S%H1197><s%> with fire, <S%H784><s%> and his bonds <S%H612><s%> dropped <S%H4549><s%> from his hands. <S%H3027><s%>

And he found <S%H4672><s%> a fresh <S%H2961><s%> jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of a donkey, <S%H2543><s%> so he reached <S%H7971><s%> <S%H3027><s%> out and took <S%H3947><s%> it and killed <S%H5221><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> with it.

Then Samson <S%H8123><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "With the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of a donkey, <S%H2543><s%> Heaps <S%H2565><s%> upon heaps, <S%H2565><s%> With the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of a donkey <S%H2543><s%> I have killed <S%H5221><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> men. <S%H376><s%>"

And it came <S%H1961><s%> about when he had finished <S%H3615><s%> speaking, <S%H1696><s%> that he threw <S%H7993><s%> the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> from his hand; <S%H3027><s%> and he named <S%H7121><s%> that place <S%H4725><s%> Ramath-lehi.

Then he became <S%H6770><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> thirsty, <S%H6770><s%> and he called <S%H7121><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Thou hast given <S%H5414><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> deliverance <S%H8668><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Thy servant, <S%H5650><s%> and now <S%H6258><s%> shall I die <S%H4191><s%> of thirst <S%H6772><s%> and fall <S%H5307><s%> into the hands <S%H3027><s%> of the uncircumcised <S%H6189><s%>?"

But God <S%H430><s%> split <S%H1234><s%> the hollow <S%H4388><s%> place that is in Lehi <S%H3896><s%> so that water <S%H4325><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> out of it. When he drank, <S%H8354><s%> his strength <S%H7307><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> and he revived. <S%H2421><s%> Therefore, <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> he named <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8034><s%> it En-hakkore, which <S%H834><s%> is in Lehi <S%H3896><s%> to this <S%H2088><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%>
So he judged <S%H8199><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>
